page.title: 14Trade
page.content: There are 3 sales every year on Tiree. Thomas Corsons run the sales . There are sales in February August and October. Buyers come in from the mainland to buy cattle and sheep from local Crofters.The sales are held at Crossapol.There are pens and a shed made for the sales.Lorries transport the animals to the pier and some times there is a special boat to take the animals to Oban.The sales are split between the cattle and the sheep sales. Lambs are sold { at the August sales, so are sheep. There is a dance held on the night of the sales.The next day the crofters spend some of their money.
